attributes.action: Allow international GCSE and A level students teacher assessed grades.
attributes.additional_details: International students have all had different amounts of in-class education. There is no fair way to conduct examinations where all students have received different educations. Distance learning is not as effective as face-to-face learning, and students should not have to compete with peers receiving a different amount of education. Teacher assessed grades that are moderated are the only way to ensure that every student conducting the international exams receive a fair grade.
attributes.background: To allow students across the globe studying for their IGCSE and international A level examinations a fair result, teacher assessed grades should be awarded. These students should not have to compete with students not taking examinations in the UK.

rejection.details:
Decisions about courses and assessments that are delivered by independent educational institutions, as opposed to state schools, are a matter for individual exam boards and educational institutions, not the Government or House of Commons.

We could accept a petition calling for the Government to prohibit any exams from taking place during the Covid-19 outbreak, if that is something you want to happen.

We understand that the current situation is stressful for many people, including students. Student Minds, a mental health charity for students, is collating guidance and developing resources to support students experiencing stress as a result of the current situation, which you may find useful: https://www.studentminds.org.uk/coronavirus.html
